title: Rewrites Economic Record - Takes Credit for Obama Gains
summary: Trump claims he 'built the greatest economy in history' and 'rescued' America from economic disaster. In reality, he inherited a strong economy from Obama (75 consecutive months of job growth) and presided over growing inequality. Claims record-low Black unemployment was his achievement when the trend started under Obama. Takes credit for stock market gains that continued Obama-era trajectory. Denies his trade war hurt farmers (required $28B bailout). Rewrites his economic record to exclude COVID crash.
keyFacts: Obama handed Trump an economy with 75 consecutive months of job growth (June 2010-Jan 2017)
Unemployment fell from 10% (Oct 2009) to 4.7% (Jan 2017) under Obama before Trump took office
Black unemployment reached record lows under Trump, but followed Obama-era downward trend line
Stock market gains under Trump averaged 11.8% annually - nearly identical to Obama's second term (11.8%)
Trump claims he 'saved' the economy; economic data shows continued Obama trends, not a rescue
GDP growth under Trump (pre-COVID): 2.5% average, lower than several Obama years
Trump's trade war cost farmers billions; required $28B government bailout - largest in US history
2020: Economy crashed under Trump (-3.4% GDP), worst since Great Depression
Trump excludes 2020 from his 'record,' claiming it 'doesn't count' due to COVID
Wage growth and job creation were actually slower under Trump than Obama's second term
Manufacturing jobs: Trump promised 'millions'; gained only 414k (pre-COVID), less than Obama's last 3 years
